creator: kuki.szabolcs@gmail.com
text:
Hi, I just tried to run again install-chainsaw.xml and it did not work.
This is because chainsaw is not under ${repository}/logging-log4j anymore but
under ${repository}/logging-chainsaw

As a first quick fix please change tag from line 36 from
    <cvs cvsRoot=":pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic"
        package="logging-log4j"
        dest="${module.dir}"
        compression="true"
        compressionlevel="6"
        quiet="true"
    />
to
    <cvs cvsRoot=":pserver:anoncvs@cvs.apache.org:/home/cvspublic"
        package="logging-chainsaw"
        dest="${module.dir}"
        compression="true"
        compressionlevel="6"
        quiet="true"
    />
Note: the package attribute was changed.

Ofcourse it would be nice to do a get from www.ibiblio.org with all the jar's
required and place it to ${chainsaw_work_dir}/lib directory.

PS: is there any way that I can check in this change?

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
This has been fixed for 1.3.  Thanks for reporting it, and see my note on the
other bug from I just closed as to why you can't commit these fixes yourself (yet).
